snippet: Officials said the defendants profited by buying the goods in low-tax states in the South and selling them illegally in New York, avoiding the state’s high taxes.
abstract: Sixteen people are arrested and charged with trafficking untaxed cigarettes in New York; officials say men, who plead not guilty, made tens of millions of dollars by buying cigarettes in Virginia, where state tax is 30 cents a pack, and selling them across New York, where they are far more expensive as a result of taxes as high as $5.85 a pack.
lead_paragraph: Officials said the defendants profited by buying the goods in low-tax states in the South and selling them illegally in New York, avoiding the state’s high taxes.

headline.seo: 16 Accused of Smuggling Cigarettes Worth Millions
headline.main: 16 Accused of Smuggling Cigarettes Worth Millions
headline.print_headline: 16 Accused of Smuggling Cigarettes Worth Millions
